comment.author: 41909278@N08
comment._content:
7 of these tough-looking (for good reason) fighters were built for Peru. This was one of the few times that the accounting number and the customer number were identical, with both being NA-50. The next fighter design in the family eventually became the P-64, but began as the NA-50A. When the British Purchasing Commission approached NAA to come up with another single seat fighter, the project was initially given the next designation in the series, NA-50B. You may know it better as the NA-73, or P-51 Mustang!

Doug MacPhail
